titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edith Horton papers 1977.472
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:13 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection includes correspondence from the New York City Department of Education to Edith Horton concerning contributions for the M. Samuel Stern Memorial Fund, which she chaired; a loyalty certificate; a deed between Alice Stiles and Frank Swimm for land in the city of Brooklyn; a teaching certificate for Edith Horton; and a printed poem with a handwritten message on the back. Edith Horton lived on Macon Street in Brooklyn and was Principal of P.S. 7 in Brooklyn.

bioghist.p: Edith Horton lived on Macon Street in Brooklyn and was Principal of P.S. 7 in Brooklyn.
